def.dt: :a stage in the process of growing :size
:full growth
:the process of growing
:progressive development :evolution
:increase expansion the growth of the oil industry
:something that grows or has grown
:an abnormal proliferation of tissue (as a tumor)
:outgrowth
:the result of growth :product
:a producing especially by growing fruits of his own growth
:anticipated progressive growth especially in capital value and income some investors prefer growth to immediate income
:a company that grows at a greater rate than the economy as a whole and that usually directs a relatively high proportion of income back into the business
:the specialized motile tip of an axon of a growing or regenerating neuron
:a substance (as a vitamin B12 or an interleukin) that promotes growth and especially cellular growth
:a vertebrate polypeptide hormone that is secreted by the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland and regulates growth
:a recombinant version of this hormone called also somatotropin
:growth regulator
:a business that has become increasingly popular or profitable
:an interest or activity that is increasingly popular or trendy
:any of various synthetic or naturally occurring plant substances (as an auxin or gibberellin) that regulate growth
:a layer of wood (as an annual ring) produced during a single period of growth
:a polypeptide hormone that stimulates cell proliferation
:any of several protein growth factors that stimulate the proliferation especially of endothelial cells and that promote angiogenesis
